originalText.text: What are they f working for? I reserved spot by the app, but, one of the person who working at the morning said seriously it is your last time to reserve the spot 9:30-8 because the stay was too long. I am curious that are they have any option to disconnect the app if do not want to reserve by the app.

originalText.text: Will not park here again.  Brought my car in to park on 6/14/2019 @ 7:35 am.  Walk around car an no scratches.  Picked up my My car @ 5:30pm that day and there was a big deep scratch on the rear bumper that wasn't there in the morning when I left it.  I spoke with the Manager, and he claims the camera systems were down that morning up until 10:30am.  This was after he told me that I entered the garage with the scratch on My car and they had video proof. I suspect they have the video proving the car did not have the scratch when I entered/hence the story about the surveillance systems being down to cover themselves.  They claim since the scratch is up high on the bumper, a car could not have possibly hit My vehicle and they are not responsible.  A word to the wise when leaving your car in a parking garage/lot, take pics or video footage all around the car before and after so that You have proof when they damage Your vehicle.

originalText.text:
Will never park here again. Pull up to lot, rung the bell and waited for the attendant (like the signs told me to do). A man rounded the corned with his arms up asking me what i wanted. Well clearly i would like to park there. I rolled my window down and told him i bought a voucher through parking panda and showed him the receipt on my phone. He asked why i didn't print it out and i told him because it literally said on my receipt to screen shot the voucher and show the attendant. He told me that he was going to have to keep my phone until i arrive later that night to pick up my car. I simply laughed and told him thats not going to work. He then told me i had to pay an additional $5.00 to park there because the prices through parking panda were not accurate (not my fault). I informed him that the website told me it would only be 34 dollars to park and he cut me off by saying and i quote, "i don't care what that website says, we've been telling parkin panda for months that the price they have listed was not accurate and they still didn't do anything to change that, you're wasting my time either you leave your car and pay the difference or get the hell out, i don't have to take your car." Considering i had to be at work and already payed for the lot i payed the difference. I later called sparking panda to see if they could confirm if what the man told me was true and it was not. If you would like to park in a parking garage with horrible service/staff than this is the garage for you.

side note: if you are going to use this garage, make sure you know how to fight because it seems as if all their staff are angry and aggressive, waiting to get physical.

Happy Parking!
